intro: Kayea oblongifolia, commonly known as the oblong-leafed kayea, is a tropical plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its elongated, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. Kayea oblongifolia is often found in shaded, moist forest environments, growing as an understory plant. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in both horticultural and ecological studies.
